title: Paladin (monster)

| The Paladin:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [lord to its kind](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD").
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor").
* wants your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [EvilHack 0.8.2 - monst.c, line 4244](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/0.8.2/src/monst.c#L4244)                                                                       |

The **Paladin**, [Template:Monsym/paladin](/index.php?title=Template:Monsym/paladin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Template:Monsym/paladin (page does not exist)"), is the [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). She is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") lawful [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") [minion](/wiki/Minion "Minion") that guards the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening") and [The Idol of Moloch](/wiki/The_Idol_of_Moloch "The Idol of Moloch"), the Infidel [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").

The Paladin has [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and possesses two weapon attacks (with the second capable of [stunning](/wiki/Stunning "Stunning") you), the ability to cast clerical [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), and a 'claw' attack that can steal the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") or the quest artifact. The theft attack prioritizes the Idol over the Amulet should you obtain it without killing her.

## Generation

The Paladin is generated atop the Idol of Moloch in the middle of a woodland-surrounded clearing within the goal level of the [Infidel quest](/wiki/Infidel_quest "Infidel quest").

She [is generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a blessed, +3 to +5 [morning star](/wiki/Morning_star "Morning star"), a [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), a [crystal plate mail](/wiki/Crystal_plate_mail "Crystal plate mail"), [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots"), [leather gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves"), a [leather cloak](/wiki/Leather_cloak "Leather cloak"), and a [potion of speed](/wiki/Potion_of_speed "Potion of speed"). As a lawful minion, all her equipment is [erodeproof](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") and non-cursed.

## Strategy

The Paladin is intended to be a difficult opponent, and is also surrounded by six [templars](/index.php?title=Templar\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Templar (page does not exist)") and two lawful [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"); the level also has a few [squeaky board](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board") traps laying around. This requires you to not only have a plan for facing the Paladin herself, but typically also a plan to deal with her fellow minions without waking her up prematurely, even with [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth").

## Encyclopedia entry

The paladin is a noble and heroic warrior, the symbol of all  
that is right and true in the world. As such, he has high ideals  
that he must maintain at all times. Throughout legend and history  
there are many heroes who could be called paladins: Roland and  
the 12 Peers of Charlemagne, Sir Lancelot, Sir Gawain, and Sir Galahad  
are all examples of the class. However, many brave and  
heroic soldiers have tried and failed to live up to the ideals of  
the paladin. It is not an easy task!  
\[ AD\&D Player's Handbook, 2nd Edition ]
html:
Paladin (monster)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the role whose rank title at XL 30 is "Paladin", see Knight.
For the player monster that can appear with the above rank, see Knight (player monster).
For the player monster that represents the role in SlashTHEM, see Paladin (player monster).
@ Paladin (No tile)
Difficulty 29
Attacks Weapon 4d4, Weapon 2d6 stun, Spell-casting 1d8 (clerical), Claw 1d6 amulet-stealing
@ Paladin (No tile)
Difficulty 29
Attacks

Weapon 4d4, Weapon 2d6 stun, Spell-casting 1d8 (clerical), Claw 1d6 amulet-stealing

Base level 24
Base experience 894
Speed 12
Base AC 0
Base MR 50
Alignment 20 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances poison, petrification
Resistances conveyed None

The Paladin:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • wants your quest artifact.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.2 - monst.c, line 4244

The Paladin, Template:Monsym/paladin, is the Infidel quest nemesis in EvilHack and Hack'EM. She is a strong lawful human minion that guards the Bell of Opening and The Idol of Moloch, the Infidel quest artifact.

The Paladin has poison resistance and possesses two weapon attacks (with the second capable of stunning you), the ability to cast clerical monster spells, and a 'claw' attack that can steal the Amulet of Yendor or the quest artifact. The theft attack prioritizes the Idol over the Amulet should you obtain it without killing her.

Generation

The Paladin is generated atop the Idol of Moloch in the middle of a woodland-surrounded clearing within the goal level of the Infidel quest.

She is generated with a blessed, +3 to +5 morning star, a shield of reflection, a crystal plate mail, high boots, leather gloves, a leather cloak, and a potion of speed. As a lawful minion, all her equipment is erodeproof and non-cursed.

Strategy

The Paladin is intended to be a difficult opponent, and is also surrounded by six templars and two lawful aligned priests; the level also has a few squeaky board traps laying around. This requires you to not only have a plan for facing the Paladin herself, but typically also a plan to deal with her fellow minions without waking her up prematurely, even with stealth.

Encyclopedia entry

The paladin is a noble and heroic warrior, the symbol of all
that is right and true in the world. As such, he has high ideals
that he must maintain at all times. Throughout legend and history
there are many heroes who could be called paladins: Roland and
the 12 Peers of Charlemagne, Sir Lancelot, Sir Gawain, and Sir Galahad
are all examples of the class. However, many brave and
heroic soldiers have tried and failed to live up to the ideals of
the paladin. It is not an easy task!
[ AD&D Player's Handbook, 2nd Edition ]

The {{varquestmon|Paladin|Infidel|nemesis|EvilHack|Hack'EM}}. She is a [[strong]] lawful [[Human (monster attribute)|human]] [[minion]] that guards the [[Bell of Opening]] and [[The Idol of Moloch]], the Infidel [[quest artifact]].

The Paladin has [[poison resistance]] and possesses two weapon attacks (with the second capable of [[stunning]] you), the ability to cast clerical [[monster spell]]s, and a 'claw' attack that can steal the [[Amulet of Yendor]] or the quest artifact. The theft attack prioritizes the Idol over the Amulet should you obtain it without killing her.

==Generation==
The Paladin is generated atop the Idol of Moloch in the middle of a woodland-surrounded clearing within the goal level of the [[Infidel quest]].

She [[monster starting inventory|is generated with]] a blessed, +3 to +5 [[morning star]], a [[shield of reflection]], a [[crystal plate mail]], [[high boots]], [[leather gloves]], a [[leather cloak]], and a [[potion of speed]]. As a lawful minion, all her equipment is [[erodeproof]] and non-cursed.

==Strategy==
The Paladin is intended to be a difficult opponent, and is also surrounded by six [[templar]]s and two lawful [[aligned priest]]s; the level also has a few [[squeaky board]] traps laying around. This requires you to not only have a plan for facing the Paladin herself, but typically also a plan to deal with her fellow minions without waking her up prematurely, even with [[stealth]].

==Encyclopedia entry==

	there are many heroes who could be called paladins: Roland and

	are all examples of the class.  However, many brave and
	heroic soldiers have tried and failed to live up to the ideals of
	the paladin.  It is not an easy task!
		[ AD&D Player's Handbook, 2nd Edition ]
